page.title: 01ECOLOGY
page.content: The area lies almost exclusively within the Peak District National Park, bordering with the outskirts of the villages of Marsden and Melthem. The most striking features of the area are the Wessenden Reservoirs, namely Butterly, Blakeley and Wessenden. The rest of the area consists predominantly of moorland whose high point can be found at West Nab(500m) in the south east corner of our area. Almost all of the eastern half of the area lies over 400m. The whole area experiences a high precipitation level 1300mm. to 1500mm. per year. The winds are generally westerly although occasional Easterlies cause some of the heavy winter snow. The area can become isolated in winter due to heavy snowfall.
